findings.title: Unprotected approve function
findings.description: The approve function is not protected, allowing unauthorized access and potential token manipulation.

findings.title: Unprotected transfer function
findings.description: The 'transfer' function lacks protection, allowing unauthorized access and potential security risks.

findings.title: Unprotected transferFrom function
findings.description: The transferFrom function is not protected and can be exploited by malicious users.

findings.title: Unprotected permit function
findings.description: The permit function does not have proper access control, allowing unauthorized users to perform certain actions.

findings.title: Unprotected mint function
findings.description: The _mint function lacks access control, allowing anyone to mint new tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected burn function
findings.description: The burn function does not have any access modifiers or reentrancy protection, allowing anyone to call it and potentially drain the contract's funds.

findings.title: Unprotected swap function
findings.description: The swap functions are unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential manipulation of token balances.

findings.title: Unprotected skim function
findings.description: The skim function is marked as external and does not have any access control, making it vulnerable to unauthorized calls.

findings.title: Unprotected sync function
findings.description: The sync function does not have any access modifiers or restrictions, making it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: Unprotected initialize function
findings.description: The initialize function is unprotected, allowing anyone to call it and potentially alter the contract's state.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The smart contract may allow an unauthorized user to upgrade the script, potentially leading to malicious code execution.
